text:
I have some experience implementing basic authentication to protect a directory area of my system and yet I am unable to password protect a section of my web site using basic auth with my new system. I keep getting presented with the following web page without every being presented with a login box. <----- BEGIN WEB OUTPUT ----- 401 Authorization Required

Authorization Required

This server could not verify that you are authorized to access the document requested. Either you supplied the wrong credentials (e.g., bad password), or your browser doesn't understand how to supply the credentials required.

Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.

Apache/2.0.40 Server at www.domain.ext Port 80
<----- END WEB OUTPUT ----- My error log reports... [Sat Apr 26 00:30:05 2003] [error] [client 192.168.xx.yy] File does not exist: /www1/error Any help is appreciated.
creator: mblevis@magma.ca
nd@perlig.de
text: This is probably a browser fault. Are you using MSIE?

Then I must be doing something wrong.  How do I present a login box to a user to
connect to a page protected with Basic Authentication using .htaccess?

Thanks!
creator: mblevis@magma.ca

text:
You don't. The user's browser does if the server sends a 401. Some browsers
(e.g. MSIE) stop displaying the box after a number of trials (e.g. 3). You have
to go into the browser preferences and to delete the stored credentials.

I'm marking this report invalid until we discover an apache bug :)
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Alternatively, it could be a problem with the ErrorDocument 401 directive
in httpd.conf.  But it almost certainly is not a bug in apache and
therefore doesn't belong in the bug database.
creator: slive@apache.org
